name: df-idl
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(cidl, cmpt(s0, crngo, crab(s1, cpw(crn(cfv(c1st, cv(s0)))), wa(wcel(cfv(cgi, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), cv(s1)), wral(s2, cv(s1), wa(wral(s3, cv(s1), wcel(co(cv(s2), cfv(c1st, cv(s0)), cv(s3)), cv(s1))), wral(s4, crn(cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), wa(wcel(co(cv(s4), cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), cv(s2)), cv(s1)), wcel(co(cv(s2), cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), cv(s4)), cv(s1))))))))))
comment: Define the class of (two-sided) ideals of a ring ` R ` . A subset of ` R ` is an ideal if it contains ` 0 ` , is closed under addition, and is closed under multiplication on either side by any element of ` R ` . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 10-Jun-2010.)
